client package¶

Submodules¶

client.add_contact module¶

class client.add_contact.AddContactDialog(transport, database, width_window=400, height_window=90)¶

Bases: QDialog

Dialog for adding a user to the contact list. Offers the user a list of possible contacts and adds the selected one to contacts.

possible_contacts_update()¶

Method for filling list of possible contacts. Creates a list of all registered users, excluding those already added to contacts and himself.

upd_possible_contacts()¶

Method for updating the list of possible contacts. Requests a list of known users from the server and updates the contents of the window.

client.add_menu_corners_radius module¶

class client.add_menu_corners_radius.AddMenuCornersRadius(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: QMenu

Changing the rendering style of a QMenu widget.

resizeEvent(self, QResizeEvent)¶

client.del_contact module¶

class client.del_contact.DelContactDialog(database, width_window=400, height_window=90)¶

Bases: QDialog

Delete contact dialog. Offers the current list of contacts, has no handlers for actions.

client.main_window module¶

class client.main_window.ClientMainWindow(database, transport, keys)¶

Bases: QMainWindow

The main user window. Contains all the main logic of the client module. The window configuration created in QTDesigner and loaded from the converted file main_window_conv.py

add_contact(new_contact)¶

The method that adds a contact to the server and client databases. After updating the databases, it also updates the contents of the window.

add_contact_action(item)¶

‘Add’ button click handler method.

add_contact_window()¶

The method that creates a dialog box for adding a contact.

clients_list_update()¶

The method for updating the list of contacts.

connection_lost()¶

Slot-handler for loss of connection with the server. Displays a warning window and terminates the application.

delete_contact(item)¶

The method that removes a contact from the server and client databases. After updating the databases, it also updates the contents of the window.

delete_contact_window()¶

The method that opens the window for deleting a contact.

history_list_update()¶

The method that fills the corresponding QListView with the history of correspondence with the current interlocutor.

make_connection(trans_obj)¶

The method for connecting signals and slots.

message(message)¶

Slot-processor of incoming messages. Performs decryption of incoming messages and saves them in the message history. Asks the user if a message received not from the current interlocutor. If necessary, change the interlocutor.

select_active_user()¶

The method event handler for a click on the list of contacts.

send_message()¶

The function of sending a message to the current interlocutor. Implements message encryption and sending.

set_active_user()¶

Chat activation method with the interlocutor.

set_disabled_input()¶

The method to make input fields inactive.

sig_205()¶

A handler slot that performs database updates at the server’s command.

client.main_window_config module¶

class client.main_window_config.Ui_MainClientWindow(width_main_window=800, height_main_window=595)¶

Bases: QMainWindow

retranslateUi(MainClientWindow)¶
setupUi(MainClientWindow)¶

client.start_dialog module¶

class client.start_dialog.UsernameDialog(width_window=300, height_window=200)¶

Bases: QDialog

Implements a start dialog asking for the user’s login and password.

click()¶

‘OK’ button handler

client.transport module¶

class client.transport.ClientTransport(port, ip, database, username, pswd, keys)¶

Bases: Thread, QObject

Implements the transport subsystem of the client module. Responsible for interacting with the server.

add_contact(contact)¶

The method that sends information about adding a contact to the server.

connection_init(port, ip)¶

The method responsible for establishing a connection to the server.

connection_lost¶

pyqtSignal(*types, name: str = …, revision: int = …, arguments: Sequence = …) -> PYQT_SIGNAL

types is normally a sequence of individual types. Each type is either a type object or a string that is the name of a C++ type. Alternatively each type could itself be a sequence of types each describing a different overloaded signal. name is the optional C++ name of the signal. If it is not specified then the name of the class attribute that is bound to the signal is used. revision is the optional revision of the signal that is exported to QML. If it is not specified then 0 is used. arguments is the optional sequence of the names of the signal’s arguments.

contacts_list_update()¶

The method that updates the list of contacts from the server.

key_request(user)¶

The method that requests the user’s public key from the server.

message_205¶

pyqtSignal(*types, name: str = …, revision: int = …, arguments: Sequence = …) -> PYQT_SIGNAL

types is normally a sequence of individual types. Each type is either a type object or a string that is the name of a C++ type. Alternatively each type could itself be a sequence of types each describing a different overloaded signal. name is the optional C++ name of the signal. If it is not specified then the name of the class attribute that is bound to the signal is used. revision is the optional revision of the signal that is exported to QML. If it is not specified then 0 is used. arguments is the optional sequence of the names of the signal’s arguments.

types is normally a sequence of individual types. Each type is either a type object or a string that is the name of a C++ type. Alternatively each type could itself be a sequence of types each describing a different overloaded signal. name is the optional C++ name of the signal. If it is not specified then the name of the class attribute that is bound to the signal is used. revision is the optional revision of the signal that is exported to QML. If it is not specified then 0 is used. arguments is the optional sequence of the names of the signal’s arguments.

process_server_answer(message)¶

The method handler for incoming messages from the server.

remove_contact(contact)¶

The method that sends information about deleting a contact to the server.

run()¶

Method containing the main cycle of the transport stream.

send_message(to, message)¶

The method that sends messages to the server for the user.

transport_shutdown()¶

The method that notifies the server that the client is shutting down.

user_list_update()¶

The method that updates the list of users from the server.
